website_summaries.verdict: The Amazon Echo Show 5 isn't quite as good as the Google Nest Hub, but it's a solid smart display that's particularly compelling as a smart alarm clock.
pros: The Amazon Echo Show 5 packs a lot of features into a compact smart display that can easily fit on your nightstand
The sunrise alarms make getting out of bed easy
The new smart home control panel gives you a handy way to control your gadgets with a touch
Plus, you still have access to all of Alexa's voice commands and a few handy privacy features like a physical shutter
cons: The similar Google Nest Hub is better at showing off your pictures, walking you through recipes and organizing your smart home
The Show 5's screen is a little too bright for a darkened room
You can't customize your snooze times, see your commands or set a sunrise alarm outside of certain hours

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I was unhappy with the Show when I first set it up. I wanted the clock to show but Amazon Tips kept minimizing the clock. After giving it 1 star, Amazon customer service reached out to me. I received an email explaining how to stop the “Things to Try” and now I love it. Here is an excerpt from that email and I hope it helps others. You can edit your home page to not show you certain things on the Echo Show 5: 1. Go to settings 2. Open Home & Clock 3. Home Content There you can turn off things like - Rotate Continuously - Discover Trending Topics or anything else you dont want to see
customer_reviews.author: T-squared

customer_reviews.title: Listen to your customers!
customer_reviews.text: The major issue could be fixed with an update. I wish I could truly personalize my homescreen and not have "Try Alexa..." advertisements constantly cycling through. Other than that I enjoy the product but its overwhelming to ALWAYS have these on the display. If an update comes, I'll pop this review up to 4 or 5 stars but this was a gift to my wife and it really takes all of the utility out of it when its pumping advertisements out.
customer_reviews.author: Will Kern

customer_reviews.title: I’m not a paid Amazon employee, this is my honest opinion.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t usually rate items on amazon, but I’m disappointed in this Echo 5. Every new Echo they make I buy and I’m thinking about returning this one. The sound is very Bass(y) and sounds almost mumbled to me. I use my Echo more for Spotify music and to control the lights in my home. The size screen doesn’t bother me, it’s just the sound. I might downgrade where the speakers, to me, were better. The video is the volume turned up to ten!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Software not ready
customer_reviews.text: Set an alarm last night. Went off fine, told Alexa to snooze. Alarm never went off again. Luckily I woke up in time to get to work. Alarm still showed on screen but when I said "Cancel Alarm" Alexa stated no alarms were set. I also have Do Not Disturb scheduled for night time and clock set to not display at night but she will not turn the screen off automatically. Going to have to switch back to my original Show. Hopefully they will fix the issues. Will check back after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Wulfekuhl

customer_reviews.title: Clunky
customer_reviews.text: The hardware is fine but the interface and software is not. Everything is so slow . Especially the smart home controls. Takes forever to load and then the icons take up the whole screen so you have to scroll to find the device you want to control. Amazon needs to really work on this across all their products by looking at how google do it. My biggest gripe is you cannot turn off the screen saver. I want to have my security cam displayed for long periods but I cannot
customer_reviews.author: LFC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Device
customer_reviews.text: I primarily use this as an alarm clock and I love it! Most of the negative reviews are from people who need to learn how to use it properly. You CAN eliminate the “try Alexa” and you CAN have a large alarm clock time display. There IS a nighttime display mode. You CAN change the clock display. I like it so much I am ordering a second one for my family room. The only thing I wish it could do was set an alarm to music. Overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Can’t see the clock!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one 34 days ago to use as a bedside alarm clock and Alexa device. Now Amazon in their infinite wisdom has changed the programming so I can no longer see the clock or have it displayed for more than a few seconds. Researched the issue as I have had very few positive experiences with their customer service lately & see many upset customers but Amazon doesn’t seem to care. It is now too late to return so it will make a good paperweight as I need a clock I can see. Once again Amazon is proving they are too big to care about their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Echo show 5 literally corners the market.
customer_reviews.text: How many video monitors have you bought that have no ability to change the angle of viewing? Well this has none. Can you buy an additional adapter to do what what should have been built in? Yes. Unlike every other echo device we have, unless the show is viewable directly you can only know it heard the wake command with a start of request sound. All the other devices have the blue ring which be seen 360 degree. This lack of 360 visual feedback banishes the echo show to a corner because if the sound is down you’ll never know it heard you. Bought 2 shows. Have 3 echoes which we love. This unf is a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Can't Fully Control Home Screen
customer_reviews.text: One of the desirable features we thought we were getting based on the advertisement images, was the large font clock display. However, not only can you not get this to be the fulltime display on the Echo 5, the continual display of suggestions from Echo of things to try means that the clock display is seldom viewable. This is very disappointing and something we all should pressure Amazon to change. It is obviously something they could do with a software update and would not change how we interact with the device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smart Amazon Advertisement Device
customer_reviews.text: I used to like this device but Amazon changed something so now all it shows me is the time in a tiny font in the upper left corner, my alarm in another even smaller font in the upper right corner, and a bunch of advertisements like - Try "Alexa, what are my deals?" permanently affixed in rotating fashion across the bottom. It's no longer a smart clock as the clock function is almost pointless. Will be returning the device and continuing to look for something that does what I want.
customer_reviews.author: This is my public name.

customer_reviews.title: Things to Try....  Please No.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these products, but it is so frustrating that you can't turn off the "Things to try" suggestions on the screen. You can google all you want, set all the sliders and app settings you want. It simply does not go away. At one point it did, but there must have been an update and I now I wish I could return all these products. For those who don't care what ad pollution is on their screen, this is a great product. For those like me, who want to see exactly what you desire, stay away. PS. Amazon does not care and probably won't until more people just dump their product.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES S MOLL

customer_reviews.title: Display has major problem - Amazon won't fix it!
customer_reviews.text: One of the uses of this device is an alarm clock - Problem is the display is blank except for small time display in upper left corner (too small to see) and annoying "Try -bla bla bla" at the center bottom of display. The support forum is full of frustrated people tired of Amazons refusal or inability to correct this problem. The forum also shows that this problem is "Resolved" - it is NOT. The display problem was caused by Amazon with a firmware update, which means they could always roll this back and return the device to usability. I am telling everyone to NOT buy any Show device until the display problem is fixed!
customer_reviews.author: MurrDog

customer_reviews.title: Big Ears But Great Assistant
customer_reviews.text: One word of caution with Alexa.... be careful talking on cell in the same room, because Alexa has transcribed my conversation and sent a text to a person I mentioned. Not the person I was talking to. Thank goodness it wasn’t bad. BUT! I use Alexa daily. Listening to music. Getting current weather. Streaming radio stations from anywhere. I use it constantly. Even spelling a word. Little assistance when needed.
customer_reviews.author: PATTI

customer_reviews.title: Latest update SUCKS!
customer_reviews.text: Echoes updated and now won’t display the clock, best display is time & temperature upper left, Try Alexa .... across the bottom. I wanted a full screen of the clock. It will do that. Spent 30 minutes on the phone with support, waste of time. They had me factory reset, now it is even worse. Just a waste of time. Not sure wants ‘Try Alexa...’ but NOT me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Moffatt

customer_reviews.title: Not supported in the Alexa app
customer_reviews.text: This device doesn't have support in the Alexa app. It's not part of the Setup a new Device options. Also when you do get it set up via the on-screen setup, the Alexa App keeps dropping it out of the device list dropdown. I edit an alarm and save the change and the device is removed from the dropdown list.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Comment_leaver

customer_reviews.title: Nonstop screen activity. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: Love the hardware. But it displays nonstop "suggestions" on the screen all day long with no way to turn it off. What? Why would I want an eye-catching distraction sitting right on my nightstand? It may be important to note that I have Echos in almost every room of my house! Around 15 of them. There's no place that you can go (not even in the garage) without an Echo standing by to answer a question or play music or a podcast. So I have every reason to add one more if it serves a useful function. This one did not! It's ridiculous. I'll rebuy it once they let you turn that off.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: No Hulu Support
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted this device as an award for six months of hard work... she is disappointed that there is no Hulu support. I would upgrade this to a 4 or 5 star had there been consistency in features across the lineup. Added Comment: Should be noted that Amazon at least cared enough to contact me... sad thing is that the customer service rep didn't know that the Echo 5 didn't do everything as the Echo Show and then when I pointed out through the Skills tab that it wasn't an option they pointed a finger a the partner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, look great with all Alexa has to offer
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Alexa devices for some years now and thought it was time to update. So I sold my Echo Spot and Echo Show 1st Gen on eBay and bought two of these little beauties. I use them to talk to family, stream SirriusXM, manage by home lighting (Phillips Hue) and a host of other things (time, weather, flight departure and arrival details etc). I think these are the perfect size. Better sharp than the Spot for video chat and better size than the Show for placement in the home (not too obvious - digital clock size). They took minutes to setup and I’m very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Sunny Las Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Sad attempt at a fun product
customer_reviews.text: This is another example of trying to cram a huge amount of premium features in a cheap device, and on the whole, it fails spectacularly. Many of the skills built specifically for the show do not actually work(Hulu, I’m looking at you), and the ones that do are fairly slow and clunky. The voice recognition is fairly poor and the sound quality tends to be grainy. As with other Echo/Fire products, the saying holds true, you do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Things To Try messages won't go away.  No way to stop them.
customer_reviews.text: I thought that by buying the new, improved Echo Show 5, I would be able to turn off the absolutely irritating "Things to Try" messages that fill the screen. No such luck. You should be able to define what you want on your screen, but for all the settings you can tweak, you can't stop these stupid Things to Try suggestions that are constantly on the screen like TV commercials. Until Amazon comes up with an option for removing Things to Try from the display, my review is One Star.
customer_reviews.author: RogerReece

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: When it’s facing away, there is no way to see if she heard you.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer 1.0

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Its just more junk not yet fully ready. Tech support is just as bad !
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: ***UPDATED*** Still Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. No YouTube or Hulu. Only Amazon Streaming. Sound quality disappointing. I can view my security cameras. So, that's a plus. Other than being an alarm clock/weather station, I really am not happy with it. ***10/13/2019 UPDATE*** My original review rated it 2 (TWO) stars. However, I am downgrading it to 1 (ONE) star. REASON: Unless I am facing the screen, even if I am a foot away, my other echo devices in other rooms will hear me, yet this one does not. In order for it to respond, I have to be facing the screen. Even if I am a foot away. I was mistaken, you can watch YouTube through the integrated browser. Still incredibly disappointed with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Generic User

customer_reviews.title: Misleading! zigbee compatible??? explain
customer_reviews.text: I want to like this but it is frustrating limited. Good: Sound Bad: It does NOT integrate with zigbee smartthings. The motion sensors do NOT work. Someone please explain how to connect all my motion sensor that are ZIGBEE and work with smartthings hubs You cannot play any of your own music..... You can embed routines in other routines. You can't show a specific pic or play a specific file with routine The drop in (think face time) is POOR quality The showing of cameras through the echo is poor compared to using the actual app on your cell phone. You cannot truly sycnh lists with iphonen reminders. Do not fall for the IFTTT hype....it is useless one way push
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Hobbess

customer_reviews.title: Worthless as an Alarm Clock, No way to keep Clock on Screen
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with my echo dot but wanted something with a clock on the front so I purchased this. Unfortunately you can't keep the clock on the device at all times. Even if you turn off all the other screens it will constantly cycle between large clock and the Try This amazon suggestions with a tiny clock that is difficult to see. This could be a very good device but I do not recommend it until they fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Rufus

customer_reviews.title: The Show 5 is limited compared to the Show 8 without a clear reason
customer_reviews.text: I legitimately cannot figure out a reason why the Echo Show 8 supports Hulu (and other popular services) but the 5 doesn't. From a developer standpoint, they share a platform, so why would the functionality be blocked? It's not like the UI wouldn't scale well to that size. The device is great especially for the price. I've really enjoyed the echo show 8, but the senseless limitations present in the 5 are frustrating, and the lack of clear communication from Amazon on why (or better yet, whether it's coming) really takes away from the appeal.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my eco dot. It was a great investment. Came out of the box ready to go. Just plug it in and it automatically connects to wifi from your older device.
customer_reviews.author: Al Moore

customer_reviews.title: Be Forewarned: Cannot Turn Off Things To Try
customer_reviews.text: For some stupid reason, the engineers at Amazon decided that people who bought this must want "Things to Try" broadcast to them on the screen as the home screen rotates to show you the time, weather, news, or any other information you might want to see on the home screen. And there is no way to turn these messages off unless you set the entire device to Do Not Disturb 24 hours a day. I called tech help and they have no solution to this. Really annoying. If it was only once when you first started up the device, that would be one thing, but every time?
customer_reviews.author: Toby

customer_reviews.title: Turn off try alexa,,Do this
customer_reviews.text: Don't like the try showing up ...You can turn all of this off and just make it stay on the Clock Face mode if you want. I did that with one of mine just this morning. To do this, you would go to Settings, Home and Clock, Home Content, and then deselect or turn off every item in the Home Content category. It takes a minute and then after that, your Echo Show will just stay on clock face mode until you changed the settings. Mine now shows the time in bold numbers in the center of the screen, as well as the temperature in smaller numbers in the upper left screen. see less
customer_reviews.author: Mike Davis

customer_reviews.title: Sunrise alarm feature doesn't work after 9 AM
customer_reviews.text: I was excited for this product because it combined everything I love about the Echo series with a sunrise alarm. Since receiving it, however, I am VERY disappointed. There is an absurd restriction - you can only set a sunrise alarm between 5 and 9 AM. How is this helpful?! Why is it necessary?! Why not allow a sunset alarm for after 9 am?? What if you have blackout curtains or work a night shift? This seems like a very easy fix that would give users more control over the product. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for what I use it for
customer_reviews.text: My only gripe is that I use this as a replacement for my alarm clock. My issue is that I want it to play a radio station at the specific time each morning, but when you set up a "routine", you can't choose from all available sources. In other words, the device can stream my local radio station, but I can't choose that option when creating the routine. Otherwise, it would be a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J Reardon

customer_reviews.title: Problems with clock display
customer_reviews.text: Amazon has changed the clock so that the time is displayed in small numbers in the upper left hand corner. Every so often the large numeral display appears in center of device. Then it goes back to the small corner display. On the bottom of the screen there are suggestions that appear on ways to use Alexa. Please reprogram so that large clock display remains on screen.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie N.

customer_reviews.title: Worthless as a bedside clock
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to use this as a clock on the night stand with Alexa capabilities like it shows in the ad. But it constantly cycles through useless crap and seldom shows the time like the ad indicates. I looked for something in the settings that would eliminate the useless crap cycle but found nothing. Even talked to Amazon tech who didn't seem to know much about the Show 5.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: NOT for use as bedside clock
customer_reviews.text: The home screen constantly runs stupid “try this” screens and makes the clock always appear as this tiny little thing you barely notice in the upper left corner. You can disable which “cards” you want to see and turn off continuous mode, but then you just get a big blank screen with “Try Alexa blah blah” and a tiny clock in the upper left corner after about 10 minutes (see picture). You cannot just have this be a bedside clock that shows you the time in a readable fashion. Utterly useless as a bedside clock, don’t waste your time or money on this self promoting pile of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: JDRun

customer_reviews.title: Most Annoying Feature
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these. I guess I should have thoroughly read the reviews before purchase. I want only the clock to be displayed. But unfortunately the screen alternately displays the clock and things to try. Turned everything off in settings including rotation but no luck. Display alternates between clock and things to try. Fix it AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: DJM

customer_reviews.title: Everything I was looking for and expected
customer_reviews.text: For my first Alexa type device, I have been quite happy with the Echo Show 5. It has customizable clock faces, and always shows me the time, day, date, and weather. I have set up many routines, added many skills, and features that work exactly as I expected. I have since bought another one. I have tested the "drop-in" and calling feature and had great audio/video quality. I can play music or listen to my books on a single Show, or all the Shows in the house simultaneously. The display during daytime or nighttime mode can be easily seen.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Like it 👍
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I pretty much got it for free when purchasing the Ring Doorbell 3. I use it as a radio/clock. And as other reviewers have already said, you can turn off the interruptions, or customize them to your liking. I personally have kept the food ideas one on, because I love cooking and it’s cool to see different ideas throughout the day. Also love the Alexa integration and the ability to arm the house or see the front door without grabbing my phone. The speakers aren’t the best, but they’re serviceable as a quiet background music player when working from home, which is every day as of this review.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob A

customer_reviews.title: READ BEFORE BUYING
customer_reviews.text: Love the Echo Dot gen 2 and 3 we own so why not add a Show 5, was my thought. WRONG. First my device doesn’t work, won’t play music and amazon said it’s my network or account. Yet my other echo devices on the same account and network are fine. They said they would get back to me in a day and never did. Support has no experience with the show 5. Second the screen really adds nothings! Too small to watch videos or use for anything other than a click. I guess the 10 inch screen may add value but not the 5. Save your money for the 10 inch or just get an Echo Dot.
customer_reviews.author: Big Shopper

customer_reviews.title: RING AND ES5
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to show my front door camera (Ring) whenever motion was detected. It announced that there was motion but I had to say “Alexa show the front door”. But it only shows for 10 minutes and I have to re-initialize it. NOT HAPPY! If this gets improved upon then I’ll order the better product.
customer_reviews.author: John Davis

customer_reviews.title: “Try, Alexa” screen or card as they call it Are TERRIBLE”
customer_reviews.text: I’m disappointed in the screen quality. Looking straight ahead direct, it looks fine, If you’re a little to the left or right you can’t see anything. Regardless, my giant complaint with all Alexa products are the advertisements. You can’t tell me Amazon hasn’t read all of these complaints. The “Try, Alexa” screen or card as they call it is beyond annoying. I agree with many of these other users... If Amazon doesn’t fix this with a firmware update I may switch to the Google products.
customer_reviews.author: vamp

customer_reviews.title: Horrible microphone...
customer_reviews.text: Ok but definitely not worth $90. As many complaints stated, the “try this” ads are annoying, and the screen is tiny. So don’t buy if you plan on using it for watching videos. But my biggest complaint is the position of the microphone... it’s on the top of the unit which is angled away from you. So it screws up CONSTANTLY. It’s practically useless, in my opinion, if you are using it to tell Alexa to do anything. Which is the main reason I buy these products! I’ll be exchanging to see if it’s defective. If it was, I’ll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: C.J.M.

customer_reviews.title: My Echo Spot was much better!
customer_reviews.text: This current version of Echo Show (5) is not up to par or my standards. It does not play ANY of my content (Cheddar, History Channel, NPR, etc.) when I use my "Good morning" feature nor will any of them play if I just ask Alexa to play them. I can no longer return it and from the other customer reviews on Amazon, I definitely do not want another one. I will be selling this one on eBay or locally, I guess, along with the new Dot and light switches I bought, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny G

customer_reviews.title: Love it even though it has one design flaw - no battery backup.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Show 5. Use mine as a nightstand alarm clock, ring doorbell/cam display center, and for music. The one design limitation I do find is there is no battery backup, so it’s use as an alarm clock is only as dependable as your power source. I guess you could plug it into a UPS, but would it have been so hard to build in a battery backup that would at least keep the alarm clock feature active during a power or internet outage?
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product but Amazon needs to address the distorted sound isssue.
customer_reviews.text: Unit itself is great. Works as a regular Alexa device, sharp video and picture. One star for audio because it frequently starts making a distorted hissing sound like an FM radio fading in and out of range. Doesn't matter if it's music, video, low volume, high volume. Apparently it is an issue that Amazon knows about but hasn't fixed yet. No reason to exchange for a new one because the issue hasn't been solved or addressed. Love the product but the sound issue will drive you nuts.
customer_reviews.author: J. Layman

customer_reviews.title: Great form factor...horrible sound
customer_reviews.text: Update 1/18/20 After using this for the last 2 months, I’ve noticed aside from the speaker, the microphone is also poor. Standing near the echo show, summoning Alexa, the echo dot across the room (20 ft away) often triggers instead. Echo show Is hard of hearing. I should have kept my spot... ————————— Form factor is much better than the Spot however the sound is really disappointing. Considering staying with the Spot due to this deficiency alone. Alexa sounds like she’s trapped in a tin can with a sinus infection. Really makes you wonder about the product team for Amazon devices...a simple test run would have quickly revealed this issue. Too bad...
customer_reviews.author: oclan

customer_reviews.title: Can't hear and can't video call
customer_reviews.text: The concept here is great. I don't mind the advertisements as much as some of the reviews here. They don't interfere with function. When it hears me, this thing is great. Shows weather forecasts and videos and the sound quality for music is fantastic. But the microphones are terrible. I can be right in front of it and it won't recognize my voice or execute any commands. It's quite terrible in that sense. More often than not, my echo Dot two rooms away will hear me before this will. It's very frustrating. Also, a lot of times if I call from device to device, it takes a minute for the video to populate
customer_reviews.author: MichaelTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good deal.
customer_reviews.text: It is much smaller than I thought. I have the previous model and it doesn’t compare. However it’s affordable and serves its purpose. I have it in the kid’s bedroom. The larger model in the family room. The screen size is equivalent to my IPhone. But we like it. I bought two when they were on sale. Gave the other to my mom. She’s struggling with the brightness but it’s probably something that can be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Ashanti

customer_reviews.title: Come on Jeff, keep trying to perfect your Show models
customer_reviews.text: I bought the original Echo Show and now the Echo Show 5. I returned the first one after it could not connect successfully with my JBL Flip 4 speakers. Amazon sent me a replacement. Same problem. Spent literally hours on the phone with several levels of CSRs. I even tried the "Call Jeff directly" option. So when the 5 came out, I ordered it. After another hour with Amazon CSR trying to get all my smart plugs to work with it. I gave up. Maybe Gen 2 or 3 will make the Show as flexible as my 4 Echo Dots. Great concept...bad execution.
customer_reviews.author: Sam C Hershfield

customer_reviews.title: Speaker started failing after One month.
customer_reviews.text: I loved it until about a month in. This isn’t an echo device I use frequently for music or listening to. We have Sonos devices we stream music to, but I’d use the echo show 5 for daily news updates and occasional podcasts while cleaning. At first I was impressed with the sound but recently my speaker has developed a “lisp”. There’s a staticky sound around s sounds. Almost like the speaker is rattling. It’s unfortunate and really annoying. It happens at all volumes - even the lowest setting. I love the size of this device but this speaker issue makes it junk.
customer_reviews.author: WKJones

customer_reviews.title: Worst at what Echo should do best.
customer_reviews.text: The microphone placement on this device is tragic. Possibly the most deaf Echo device I've tried. Stick with a Dot or literally only thing but these screened abominations. Besides never hearing me, the physical screen is unbelievably slow. Prepare to hit the same area 2, 3, 4 times before it reacts and ultimately shows you the wrong thing due to incredible interface delays. Amazon thinks you are dumb, that's why they sell these things with bad mic placement and bad software. Why else would they sell this?
customer_reviews.author: F. Bauman

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed in this purchase. Such hype for an item that almost seems useless. The only thing I have seen on the Show, is the time and weather, nothing else. Tried everything, but to no avail.Re-connect, restart, reboot, change networks, until I could scream!!! If I can't get it to work by the end of the week, back it goes, along with the other extra Echos and shows I bought. Sorry! Can't give a good review if you can't base it on anything viable!
customer_reviews.author: Guadalupe Morales

customer_reviews.title: Just not what it should be
customer_reviews.text: When I bought it I was promised certain features like Hulu and Netflix which just aren't there. And my understanding is that it will not be added although the three different people I spoke to about it all gave me different answers. Very frustrating. It would work just fine in the Firefox browser except there is no desktop mode in the browser so I can't access many websites same problem with the Amazon browser no desktop view. It also has terrible microphones most of the time it doesn't hear me. And it doesn't get my location correctly no matter what I set it to. Overall huge disappointment. And the worst support, the staff is unknowledgeable in support.
customer_reviews.author: Dan R.

customer_reviews.title: No way to turn off "Things to try" Message
customer_reviews.text: Sorry Amazon. 1 star review until you make a toggle switch to turn off the "things to try" message. This is my third echo/alexa device. I don't need this info taking up room on the small screen and blocking the photo I have there.
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: Hoping to like it more with some time...
customer_reviews.text: OMG Please create some more wake words. You want us to utilize these in every room, however, I'm trying to pull up a recipe on the echo 5 in the kitchen, and my dot across the house is telling me she doesn't have video capabilities. This happens all the time with all the devices. More wake words PLEASE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Hot Garbage

customer_reviews.title: This is one of these things that, after you have it, you wondered how you made it without it.
customer_reviews.text: I have now bought four of these. They are perfect for the bedside table for a clock and does all the amazing things my Echo Spot did with a larger, excellent display.

customer_reviews.title: Worthlesa

customer_reviews.title: barely heard anything

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Alexa is dumb AF. 99% of the questions she answers are incorrect and I'm left googling it myself. Additionally, it's practically all ads all the time, even after you disable those features... "Did you want to try this?" "Try saying ..." GARBAGE GARBAGE GARBAGE. THERE HASNT BEEN LIVE BASKETBALL IN 6 WEEKS! GET OUT OF MY FACE! (PS: The Lakers and Jazz are fine, but neither are my home town team.. WTF!!?! customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly useful !
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a replacement for my bedside clock-radio. What a useful device ! The clock automatically adjusts for lighting conditions and dims itself nicely when I turn out the lights. Plus I get internet radio, local radio (via internet) , alarms, notifications and a lot more - all voice activated and with a touch screen. Also it has a nice and small footprint on my night table. I actually read the other reviews and used the settings to turn of the default notifications so there are zero "advertisements" (as other's claimed) to disturb me. Do the same and you'll love this device.
customer_reviews.author: TechnoLady

customer_reviews.title: Defective New Echo Show 5
customer_reviews.text: I recently bough this item, and it didn't work properly. The screen was frozen when trying to watch a video, the audio was defective too, and Alexa didn't follow commands. customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.

I mainly use for music play and to be blunt this product just sucks. I will be speaking to my Alexa Show asking it to play something, in a completely normal tone while standing right beside it I might add and it wont pick my up but the one I have downstairs will. It doesnt understand my requests at least 70% of the time. Waste of money

customer_reviews.title: Alexa ads viewing device (UPDATED - better)
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this device 3 months ago I mostly liked it, but then it started displaying "Try asking Alexa.." almost continuously instead of showing the big clock. But for the past week that is better and now I only get Alexa suggestions about once a day. Maybe Amazon is paying attention to all the reviews complaining about this. Original review: Every time I look over to see the time, this screen is showing a message about something I should try out with Alexa. I have all the home screen notifications turned off but you cannot turn off Alexa ads. It appears that Alexa ads have taken over all Echo devices with a screen.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Mcgehee

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Quick Review
customer_reviews.text: Easy and Quick Review: screen is not bad, sound quality is ok, Video function works well, HATE< HATE< HATE the constant ads! Come on Amazon, I buy a lot of stuff from you, let me opt out or your going to piss of a core customer.

customer_reviews.title: Worst product

customer_reviews.title: Echo Show 5 is just right
customer_reviews.text: Purchased an Echo show 5 for my bedroom as a clock and smart home control to compliment an Echo Show 8 that I us for my main home control. It's a phone sized screen which is nice when you need a screen on your Amazon Echo device but dont want to have anything much bigger or intrusive. Easy to setup and integrate in to my Alexa integrated Smart Home.

customer_reviews.title: epic fail

customer_reviews.title: Good smart display for bedside
customer_reviews.text: Love the screen clarity and alexa and ring integration. I hope that future updates make the interface a bit more user friendly. Currently there's no feature to change light bulb color or temperature with the screen. Also the screen is always prompting new things to try, which frankly I find distracting and not in all useful. Overall though it's a great product to have next to your bedside.
customer_reviews.author: G. Valadez

customer_reviews.title: Not cordless and doesn’t stay on continuously
customer_reviews.text: We originally bought this as a baby monitor to pair with our security cameras for nighttime. When purchased, we didn’t realize it wasn’t cordless. Big set back. The other setback is you can’t keep it on continuously. It closes our security camera app and defeats the purpose of using as a baby monitor. There isn’t an option to keep it on continuously. Add that feature and it would be perfect. Was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Marlena

customer_reviews.title: have 6 echo dots that work great, this echo show is terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 echo dots that are amazing! so I thought I would buy this echo show so we could use it with ring. This echo show is terrible! The voice recognition is barely existent. When standing a few feet away, it can not pick up our voices, and instead one of the echo dots which are in a room over 10 feet away will pick up our voice! This only seems to work when I am within 1 foot of it. I contacted Amazon and they replaced it but the new one is the same model and the same problems for us! wonder why there are so many great reviews?
customer_reviews.author: meg

customer_reviews.title: Please Give Me Control Over The Content Displayed On My Screen
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like the device other then I have little to no control over the content displayed on the screen. If I wish to play music, view a news feed, or any of the currently available content you are hit with a "Try this or Try that" message at the bottom of the screen. Please give me control over the content displayed on my device... Thank you.

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend Echo Show 8 instead
customer_reviews.text: If I have music too loud, she usually won't hear me say her name. Also had some problems with getting her to play certain youtube videos and I have to click over and over to make youtube video full screen. Never registers the first time. I still highly recommend alexa screens, but I have the Echo Show 8 as well and that one works so much better and is obviously so much louder. I would spend the extra few bucks to get the Show 8 because the screen difference between the two is pretty big. The echo show 8 is significantly bigger for like an extra $30 and doesn't give me a single problem.

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad unit for the price, just wish that I had bought a bigger screen !!
customer_reviews.text: For the most part I like the Show 5. One regret is that I didn't by the bigger screen becaif you are not close to it, it is hard to read the text. customer_reviews.text: **Update Aug 11, 2020** Completely stopped working. 8 months in. Keep in mind this unit just sits there plugged in. So no one really touches it. 8 months later it’s a paperweight. What a waste Dec 2019- Just got this yesterday. It's response time is so slow with anything. Tried it with some wifi switches and arlo, it took what seemed forever for it to respond. Also, the main screen doesnt stay on the clock or whatever you choose. Instead you get stupid recommendations and it changing out. So annoying. I wanted it to stay as a clock when non in use, but cant seem to do that. Rather have the dot over this. Not worth $50.

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of "Things to try" and maybe this would be a good device
customer_reviews.text: The voice recognition seems to be worse than on my 2nd- and 3rd-gen Echo dots. The reason for the overall low rating is the "Things to try" reminders at the bottom of the screen. As far as I can tell, there is no way to turn these off unless you want your device to simply be a clock all the time. I would like to be able to have my calendar and my own photos rotating on the screen without needing to see these distracting reminders, but it seems Amazon is intent on keeping them. Until they are removed, I won't be buying any more Echo devices with screens.

customer_reviews.title: Best echo ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Everything, alarm, weather, communicate with other rooms and my brother who lives approx 20-30 miles away. Love the fact that you can close the cam. Sound is great and screen quality is good enough.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!!

The Prime Days price is great!!!

customer_reviews.title: Very sad sound quality...

customer_reviews.text: Pros: Size Touch Screen Customize Display Links to Ring Cameras Cons: Home Screen Options What took me so... long to buy this? Probably because our kids knew we were still playing our old vinyl albums yet streaming songs from amazon music. And we wouldn't buy one for ourselves. The Echo Show 5 is perfect in it's place on the kitchen island. Small enough to be inconspicuous but large enough to easily read the temperature & time. And I learned I'd been singing the wrong lyrics to a song for 20 yrs. Thanks Alexa. And no, it doesn't answer to "Siri"
customer_reviews.author: niapriv

customer_reviews.title: An Underrated Alexa Device
customer_reviews.text: I've been an Alexa freak (probably not the best decision for privacy) since the devices came out. We've had a gen 1 Alexa cylinder, several dots, the Echo Look, Echo Auto, and now this. The Echo Look and Echo Auto are garbage, hence is probably why they've discontinued the Echo Look. However, this device is probably my favorite out of all of them. Not only does it have the extra features of video, lyrics when playing from my Amazon Music library, but it also handles the other skills I use as well as having a nice display for weather and news. Nothing more to say, then I'm very happy with it and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

product_meta.title: Echo Show 5 -- Smart display with Alexa – stay connected with video calling - Charcoal
feature_bullets: Alexa can show you more – Compact 5.5” smart display ready to help manage your day, entertain at a glance, and connect you to friends and family.
Made to fit your life – Cook along to step-by-step recipes. Easily update to-do lists and calendars. Glance at weather and traffic on your way out.
Big entertainment – Ask Alexa to show you movie trailers, TV shows, movies, or the news. Or listen to radio stations, podcasts, and audiobooks.
Control your smart home – Voice control compatible devices or manage them on the easy-to-use display. Ask Alexa to show you security cameras, control lights, and adjust thermostats.
Connect with video calling and messaging – Call friends and family who have the Alexa app, an Echo device with a screen, or Skype. Make announcements to other devices in your home.
Make it yours – Choose the clock face that fits your style best. Use your favorite photos on the home screen. Create morning routines to start your day.
Designed to protect your privacy - Turn off the microphone and camera with one press of a button. Slide the built-in shutter to cover the camera.
